items.content:
Storage Made Easy has a Technical Sales engineer role available at its Sutton, London office. The role can be fully office based or a mixture of office / work from home dependent on applicant’s location. 


 


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


 



  • Must have a good level of technical expertise in Linux and Cloud technologies

  • Deliver presentations and demos to prospects, customers and partners in the UK and across EMEA

  • Deploy and configuration of cloud and on-site Proof of Concepts for prospects

  • Assess prospect / customer requirements and infrastructure and design appropriate solutions

  • Qualify opportunities and determine the technical requirements for the prospects and the Storage Made Easy suite of product offerings

  • Provide technical responses to RFI’s and RFPs.

  • Conduct Proof-Of-Concepts of Storage Made Easy’s solutions

  • Communicate Storage Made Easy product roadmaps to prospects, customers and partners

  • Provide product/market input to Product Management / Engineering

  • Contribute to / create white papers, technical briefs, case-studies, Blog posts, and other tools to be leveraged by the Storage Made Easy Sales and Pre-Sales Organisation

  • Represent Storage Made Easy at Users group, conferences and industry events

  • Stay up-to-date on major competing vendors and industry initiative / developments

  • Provide post-Sales support to customers as part of the sales transition, as well as additional escalation for the Storage Made Easy Support Team

  • Regular travel within the assigned EMEA-I territory, some overnight; quarterly travel to California for training


 


REQUIRED:


 



  • Experience in Object and File storage solutions

  • Proven network infrastructure / architecture experience

  • Experience with virtual machines and hypervisors e.g. VMWare ESXi, Microsoft Hyper-V will be an advantage

  • Excellent relevant field experience

  • 3+ years of Storage or software related xperience with storage or software vendors - must be able to demo to customers.

  • Experience in working with server environment running UNIX, Linux or Windows.

  • MUST have relevant experience selling to / supporting Enterprise companies


 


PREFERRED:


 



  • Expertise in Object storage solutions such as Amazon S3 or Microsoft Azure

  • General storage industry knowledge and understanding; interoperability; competitive landscape

  • Expertise in troubleshooting and interfacing with storage systems, S3, NAS and SAN

  • Experience in HPC environments, object storage, storage filer applications such as NAS (CIFS, NFS), back-up applications (Netbackup/Commvault) and data migration tools or techniques and archival

  • Experience in setting up, managing, maintaining Linux servers

  • Hands-on networking experience – Networking, Firewalls and Load-balancing


 


SKILLS:


 



  • Must be a good listener, creative, intuitive, a problem solver and have the ability to resolve problems in potentially stressful situations

  • Must be able to work independently but also an adaptive team player

  • Work in a globally distributed team, keeping your peers in other regions up to date

  • Excellent communication skills and able to discuss technical topics either written or oral

  • Excellent customer presentation skills

  • The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, customer focused, resourceful and enthusiastic

  • Ability to develop and effectively communicate business cases and justifications to internal and external stakeholders as required to drive business forward


 


COMPENSATION:


 



  • Good Salary offered to the right candidate, commensurate with experience

  • Share Options

  • Your day off on your birthday because doesn’t everyone want that !


 


ABOUT STORAGE MADE EASY:


 



  • Storage Made Easy or SME as it is affectionately known by its customers is an exciting UK startup in the cloud computing space that provides a multi-cloud content management solution called the Enterprise File Fabric.

  • If you are the right candidate you will visit StorageMadeEasy.com to find out more !

items.title: Business Development Manager
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
This is an exciting opportunity to join our ambitious, fast-moving B2B tech team where you will play a key role in accelerating and growing our user base by building key relationships with customers around the world.

 

We’re seeking an energetic, natural business driver who is ambitious and loves challenges to help take Illuminout to its next phase.  If you are someone who likes to see his/her efforts make an immediate impact, then this role is for you!

 

 

What it is

 

IlluminOut empowers users to drive change throughout an organisation by leveraging information on a company's employees, management and competitive benchmarks, transforming departing employees into a company's greatest asset.

 

With IlluminOut, all exit data is dynamically captured and used to generate actionable results across the organisation as well as for specific departments and line managers. Users can test new ideas and see their impact on turnover over time, with historic tracking and quick overviews at their fingertips. Challenges and opportunities are identified as they emerge to help build a culture that engages employees and allows them to thrive.

 

 

Who we are

 

An award-winning team of individuals who have over 15 years of experience in Product Launches, Digital Marketing, Strategy & People Management across start-ups and global enterprises. Also, really rather friendly and always open to new ideas!

 

 

Who you are 

 

You love the organised chaos of a start-up. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where no two days are same. You get excited about the idea of having a direct impact on a company. You are an extroverted person, who gets their energy from engaging with other people and doesn’t get demoralised by rejection. You dig challenges and solving problems. You want to work in an open, honest and warm team that values its members as change drivers. 

 

 

What you'll do



  • Identifying and managing leads for successful onboarding



  • Develop sales pitch, business cases and presentations for prospects



  • Negotiate terms, contracts and close deals



  • Develop strong relationships with key senior stakeholders



  • Event attendance and networking on behalf of the company



  • Maintain accurate pipeline and reporting




Who we need



  • At least 3 years' experience in a business development role - agency, commercial, or corporate backgrounds welcome. Experience in HR/People Development preferable but not required



  • Track record of developing strong commercial relationships with senior stakeholders



  • Track record of devising creative solutions to sales challenges



  • Excellent personal network



  • Highly effective communicator, a confident presenter with strong strategic and commercial acumen



  • Excellent interpersonal and team working skills



  • Independent self-starter. The role will require someone who can manage their own time and effectively plan their day to day activities and be strategic to win clients



  • Have drive, a strong entrepreneurial instinct, desire to work in a start-up environment, and know when to seize an opportunity




What you get



  • Contract role starting at 50% commission with uncapped earnings

  • Flexible working hours to suit your schedule

  • Remote working options available

  • Unhindered ability to expand to new markets


www.illuminout.com

items.title: REMOTE- Outside Flooring Sales Representative - Stone, LVT
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Outside Sales, Business Development, Natural Stone Sales, Hardwood flooring sales, Selling to Fabricators, Tile Sales, Hardscaping

If you are a REMOTE- Outside Flooring Sales Executive - Stone, Tiles and LVT with experience in the field, please read on!

We are a leading nationwide distributor of flooring, countertop, wall tile and hardscaping products. We have distribution centers across the United States and Canada. Our product line includes natural stone products imported from over 36 countries on six continents. In addition, we offer an extensive offering of porcelain, ceramic, glass and quartz products.

We are currently seeking candidates for an outstanding Flooring Sales Representative - Stone, Tiles and LVT. Ideal candidates will have experience selling to either flooring retail store, commercial construction companies or landscaping suppliers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- AWARD WINNING EXCELLENCE (Well Trusted Leader for over 40+ years)
- GENEROUS Compensation Structure + Telecommute Flexibility OFFERED
- FANTASTIC Team and Leadership
- Excellent Benefits (Medical, Dental, Life, Vision + Short Term Disability)
- SOLID PTO/Vacation time

What You Will Be Doing

Develops relationships with current customers and potential customers within specific territory.
Assist customers by providing knowledge and training company products to their store personnel, to ensure personnel is able to present product and negotiate
well with consumers.
Understands our products, our market competition and how to position products to overcome these factors.
Manages displays, samples, and selling tools for customer availability.
Understands retail business financials to consult with dealers on retail pricing, advertising, promotions and ROI.
Quotes prices, discusses credit terms and prepares sales contracts for customer orders
Estimates date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of company's delivery schedules.
Review and analyze various sales reports to identify sales potential with current customers and potential new customers.
Utilize any and all marketing tools such as catalogs, brochures and vendor collateral to broaden reach in territory and promote company product.
Researches and analyzes customer needs and demands based on market information.
Investigates and resolves customer claims/problems with deliveries, returns and credits.
Attends trade shows throughout the year as required.
Travels 40% - 80% locally, occasionally nationally and/or internationally.
Performs additional duties as required and or requested.

What You Need for this Position

Bachelor's Degree preferred.
Two (2) plus years' experience in channel distribution sales.
Minimum of 2 years of related industry experience; natural stone, tile or hard flooring industries.

What's In It for You

Competitive base salary plus commissions and full benefits package!
Work from your home office and travel into territory!So, if you are a Outside Flooring Sales Executive - Stone, Tiles and Hardscaping with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Vice President of Business Development
items.content:
Vice President of Business Development at CoreAxis

Remote
  • CoreAxis
  • Remote

Job Summary

CoreAxis is an industry-leading strategy consulting and services firm focused on providing world-class custom learning and development, eLearning, leadership and scalable talent solutions to global brands. We are a virtual company with aggressive growth goals for the organization. We pride ourselves on the forward-thinking approach that has made us an award winner in the industry. We offer our employees an exciting work environment and plenty of opportunity for advancement.

We are seeking a Vice President of Business Development to join our leadership team. As the VP of Business Development, you will be responsible for growing the revenue and brand of the company. We are looking for a true ‘rainmaker’ and professional with client acquisition experience. The VP of Business Development will be 100% committed to growing our client base and pipeline, and implementing sales strategy and planning with creative problem-solving. The role is an individual contributor position that will report to the CEO.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Provide superior client service through strong communication skills and sales experience.
  • Work collaboratively with staff to maintain a team environment to accomplish the tasks necessary to serve and support the company.
  • Develop, manage and achieve sales targets and goals.
  • Successfully prospect, identify and qualify sales opportunities, as well as conduct all aspects of negotiation and closure.
  • Actively manage existing clients and establish new customer base.
  • Ability to develop long-term relationships with customers through managing and interpreting their requirements.
  • Ability to collaborate, work and communicate with current sales team in generating new sales from our established customer base.
  • Manage and evolve complex business models while maintaining simplicity.
  • Build a solid pipeline to ensure successful achievement of revenue and other sales-related targets.
  • Develop and measure quarterly plans to ensure we meet company growth targets.
  • Manage all opportunities by navigating the critical success factors, competitive challenges, partner landscape, objections and other complex issues to ensure successful execution.
  • Articulate the path to meet and exceed forecasted targets.
  • Be highly organized and comfortable working in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment.
  • Be a self-starter who takes initiative, is highly motivated and is accountable.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, or equivalent
  • Minimum 10+ years selling managed services, training and development, eLearning, custom content and leadership solutions
  • Solid business acumen, senior management and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to develop strong relationships and work with senior-level executives
  • Exceptional sales, marketing, customer service and decision-making skills
  • Exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Strong leadership, project management and time management skills
  • Passion for our industry and solid relationships with network of colleagues
  • Highly proficient with computer applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
  • Experience working in a managed services / professional services / staffing organization is a plus
Apply for job

items.title: DockYard, Inc. : Business Developer (Remote)
items.content:
Business Developer (Remote)

DockYard is hiring a Business Developer to identify and secure new partnerships in the web application development space. This is an excellent opportunity for anyone interested in joining a rapidly growing professional services consultancy on the forefront of new tech. We work with some of the world’s largest brands (i.e., Apple, Netflix) to design and develop their most ambitious projects.

As a member of the Business Development team, you will play an integral role in helping DockYard continue on our high-growth trajectory. From establishing new partnerships, to ensuring the successful delivery of projects in an account manager capacity, the Business Developer position will provide a diverse range of responsibilities. 

The right candidate will be entrepreneurial with a proactive approach to her/his work, but also possess a “team-first” mentality. This individual will be genuinely interested in the digital product development lifecycle and will be excited to tailor new project opportunities to the services DockYard provides.

Responsibilities:
  • Qualifying inbound leads received through dockyard.com.
  • Conducting research on potential clients and industries.
  • Stewarding potential projects from the lead qualifying stage, to proposal development (alongside design, engineering, project management), through contract negotiation, to project kickoff.
  • Serving in an account management capacity for existing clients.
  • Supporting outbound BD efforts through research, list-building, and outreach.
  • Drafting weekly invoices.
  • Completing other detail-oriented tasks that may be repetitive.

Requirements

Prior experience in professional services – especially account management, sales, product management, or project management – is highly desirable; however, given the specialized nature of DockYard’s services and the complexity of our engagements, we anticipate a fair amount of ramp up time for new Business Developers. Applicants should be hungry to learn and unabashed about asking questions early on.

As a remote company, it is important that applicants be comfortable with modern tools for communications (e.g., Slack), productivity (e.g., GSuite), and relationship management (e.g., we use Copper.com as our CRM). This position requires a clean, quiet work environment suitable for video conferencing, attire that mirrors our clients’ dress code, and a sense of good “digital etiquette.” This role will require intermittent travel.

items.title: Systems Consultant (Sales Engineer), Global Accounts, Remote
items.content:
h2>Senior Presales Systems Engineer

Competitive salary

Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company - we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities.

Our field sales professionals rely on proactive technical support during the sales process - and our expert Systems Engineering team always steps up to the mark. We lead the development and implementation of complex and specialized products, applications, services and solutions. From delivering sales presentations and product demonstrations, to developing detailed installations or system integration plans, we ensure customers get the innovative, relevant, interoperable solutions they need.
Key Responsibilities

  • At this level, supports highly complex and high value accounts exercising wide latitude to determine objectives and approaches
  • Gains access and manages relationships with senior level executives and IT decision makers Devises new approaches/methods to selling enterprise/client products and services
  • Verifies operability of highly complex product and service configuration within the customer-s environment that addresses critical issues Identifies and allocates roles and responsibilities required to support account team
  • Synthesizes market, industry and competitor data to anticipate how external factors will influence the position of the solution and makes decisions that impact the long term success of the business
  • Creates formal networks internally and externally with industry experts and key decision makers
  • Leverages third-party and/or the Channel to create and position the solution
  • Assumes leadership role in analyzing requirements and performing advanced systems integration and providing technical expertise to design and implement solution across breadth of Dell and third-party products and services
  • Senior level sales engineer with expert understanding of complex products and services portfolio
  • Leveraged as coach/mentor to others
  • Provides customer/industry/market insight to internal leaders and cross-functional groups
  • Qualifies the most complex sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding
  • Presents the design and value of proposed solution and business case to customers, prospects and management at the executive level


Essential Requirements:

  • Typically requires 12+ years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree
  • Assists in formulating the customer-s long- term strategic vision and our role as a strategic partner Influences the future development of enterprise/client technology, products, and services
  • Expected to be part of the overall product development cycle Works with strategic planning teams to define future directions and strategies for products and services


Benefits

We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities - all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

If you have the technical skills to take our sales to the next level, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here .
- provided by Dice

items.title: FurstPerson, Inc.: Business Development Representative
items.content:
Business Development Representative

Job Title:              Business Development Representative (full time or part time)

Location:             Remote Office / Work from Home

Manager:             Vice President, Sales and Marketing


FurstPerson helps customers achieve better performance and profitability by developing, implementing, and managing pre-hire talent selection solutions designed to improve the quality of hire.  The unique blend of high-touch consultation, advanced technology, measurement accuracy, and employment lifecycle analytics enables FurstPerson to build innovative, award-winning solutions that deliver an average $32:1 return on investment.

About this role:

We are looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our team.  This is a crucial role responsible for managing and organizing the initial prospect contact, gather and document needs, and position FurstPerson as a solution that can help the prospect improve their quality of hire.  As a BDR, you will seek new business opportunities by contacting potential customers through a variety of sources (e.g., LinkedIn, cold calls, event lists, content downloads).

A successful BDR should have previous experience in lead generation and entry-level sales. This role requires strong communication skills and a “hunter” mentality. If you are motivated and results-driven, we’d like to meet you.

As BDR, you will be responsible for the following activities:
  • Act as a “hunter” to prospect for potential customers,
  • Present FurstPerson to potential customers, positioning FurstPerson’s value proposition persuasively, both verbally and in writing,
  • Qualify leads as sales opportunities,
  • Set up meetings between prospect and Enterprise Sales team,
  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market,
  • Report to VP of Sales on weekly results.

As a BDR, you will:
  • Serve as a brand enthusiast for FurstPerson’s suite of products and solutions,
  • Develop Enterprise-level sales skills through ongoing training,
  • Develop knowledge and expertise in pre-hire assessment and talent identification,
  • Learn how to manage complex sales cycles, and
  • Contribute to FurstPerson’s advancement through ideas, collaboration, and results.

Individuals who demonstrate success in the BDR role may have the opportunity advance into an Enterprise Sales role with FurstPerson.

Successful Candidate(s) will Possess:
  • Background in entry-level sales, account management, business development or a similar role
  • Demonstrable history of achieving quota-based milestones,
  • Hands-on experience with sales techniques (including cold calling or prospecting)
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills,
  • Excellent professional networking skills,
  • Ability to transfer prospects to sales team seamlessly,
  • Proficiency with Microsoft® Word®, and Outlook®,
  • Willingness to travel to support sales opportunities and events,
  • Hubspot CRM experience preferred, but not required,
  • BS or BA Degree, or relevant work history.

items.title: B2B Lead Generation Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
B2B Lead Generation Specialist at Expert Business Development

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

*** 3-5 years of B2B relationship building experience required! ***

Compensation: $18.25 hourly + Bonuses based on performance (Earning potential: $18.25 – $27.00 hourly)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (minimum 20 hours per week)

Expert Business Development (EBD) is seeking talented B2B Lead Generation Specialists to join our team. Qualified candidates must have a proven track record of success in B2B outbound cold-calling to set appointments and generate leads. This position requires a minimum of 20 hours per week of availability. Lead Generation Specialists may have the ability to expand to 40 hours per week contingent on their productivity. It is a work from home position with a flexible schedule (Monday – Friday).

A Lead Generation Specialist introduces new corporate products or services to potential prospects through outbound cold-calling. Primary responsibilities involve tracking prospects, appointment setting and following up on leads the organization provides through our CRM application, based on the clients’ project needs. A Lead Generation Specialist handles the overall appointment coordination between the prospect and the client. Our seasoned Specialists are business professionals with a strong background in building B2B relationships. EBD prides itself in building long term relationships with our clients which extend beyond the conclusion of a project.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • B2B outbound cold-calling reaching C level executives in small, mid and large size companies
  • Ability to engage gatekeepers to identify and reach key decision makers
  • Initiate calls to build rapport with key decision makers to set pre-qualified appointments
  • Record and manage prospect data within a web-based CRM application
  • Meet established productivity and performance goals

Experience and Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3-5 years building B2B relationships
  • College degree strongly preferred or equivalent work experience
  • Goal oriented, self-motivated, results driven individual working remotelyfrom a quiet home office
  • Seasoned background in cold calling and lead generation incorporating our signature “Respectful Persistence”
  • Exceptional telephone sales and documentation skills
  • Strong organizational and effective time management skills
  • Professional with a high level of integrity
  • Computer proficiency is required, including experience with CRM software

Compensation

Hourly base pay ranges from $18.25 to $21.25 based on performance outcomes, documentation skills and meeting established goals. Bonuses for qualified appointments can range from $12.00 to $25.00 based on the complexity of the project. In addition, we offer the potential for quarterly performance bonuses, documentation bonuses and bonuses for exceptional client feedback. Our better performing agents can realistically make $25 an hour or more. This is an Independent Contractor 1099 position.

About Expert Business Development:

Expert Business Development is a business-to-business (B2B) relationship development company that assists its clients in developing and maintaining crucial business sales relationships. Specifically, Expert Business Development works with financial service organizations to develop sales strategies and relationship building skills, and focuses on areas like appointment setting and lead generation, database development, expert lead management, and sales process design. The clients that Expert Business Development works with include banks, credit unions, financial providers, corporations, entrepreneurial firms and vendors to banks and financial companies. Expert Business Development was founded in 1993 and is located in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania. If you are interested in learning more about Expert Business Development, please visit our website www.expertbizdev.com for additional information.

Apply for job

items.title: Business Development Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Turing Fest is the top cross-functional tech conference in Europe and the go-to tech event in Scotland. Our purpose is to create events and connections that drive the growth of the tech ecosystem in Scotland, and beyond.


Currently, we run three events throughout the year, and we will be adding 1-2 additional events each year as we work to expand our reach and our brand. This is where you come in!  With this scaling business comes a scaling team. 


We are looking for the first full-time hire in the commercial team to help shape our future. 


Our Commercial Director will be heading on maternity leave for the bulk of 2020.  As such, we need an individual who is fully capable and confident to work independently.


This role is highly autonomous, but highly flexible. We are a remote team so a self-starter with self-discipline is essential. You will have many face-to-face meetings and video calls with prospects each day, so it is an interactive role in the modern tech world.


Responsibilities:



  • Achieve set revenue targets for the commercial division 

  • Sell sponsorships for the following events through a combination of personalised outreach and macro campaigns:


    • The Next Gen 2020 (4 dinners/year; once per quarter)

    • Turing Founders

    • Turing Fest

    • Scottish Tech Startup Awards

    • Pending FinTech Event

    • Pending Marketing event




  • Help adapt and shape the sponsorship offerings for the various events throughout the year

  • Manage the entire sales process from start to finish (initial outreach through to contract)

  • Work closely with Marketing and Operations teams to ensure cohesion and fluid execution in the run up to, during, and after each event 

  • Form lasting relationships with our network 

  • Keep meticulous records in company CRM system

  • Attend various events around the world


We are a remote team with an HQ in Edinburgh so we can be flexible with your geographic location, as long as it is in Europe! You will have the option to join a coworking space with other colleagues if you are based in London, on your own if based in another Euopean city, or work from home if appropriate. If you are based in Edinburgh, you will have a desk in our HQ with the bulk of the team. 


Benefits:



  • Excellent Bonus Structure 

  • Flexible working

  • Opportunity to travel the world for various events

  • Pension

  • Part of a dynamic, growing team with a well-respected and expanding brand

  • Have a direct impact on our future growth

items.title: Business Development Manager
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
We’re much more than a fintech startup. We are a team of freethinking individuals who strongly believe in disrupting the status quo and putting real power back into the hands of customers. As a multinational team with headquarters in London, we have come together to build ZIPZERO, a mobile app that makes your life just a little bit easier by helping make ends meet. Use the app to snap photos of any and all receipts to get at least 1% of each transaction into your ZIPZERO wallet. But unlike other cashback services, we put your rewards directly towards your bills. You can use the funds you’ve earned to help cover essential utility bills like electricity, gas, telephone, internet, tv or council tax every month.


The big idea is to make the things you want help pay for the things you need. Our goal with ZIPZERO is to take the money flowing through the marketing monopoly and divert it back to hardworking consumers. Rather than pour more money into the pockets of millionaires who own social networking platforms, we want to put more money in your pockets. We want to help everyday households working so hard to break even each month to reach their goals and pay the bills. Our currency is peace of mind. 


Wanted


BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER


As a member of ZIPZERO’s international team you’d be responsible for:



  • Multi-channel sales strategy planning and implementation

  • Driving partnerships with e-commerce and retail brands

  • Seek new and grow existing relationships with affiliate networks, key affiliates and national brands

  • Managing the existing accounts, maintaining good relations with our partners


 Who are we looking for exactly?


Someone who’s organized, ambitious, proactive and talented, with 3-5 years of experience in a similar position! We definitely need someone who has excellent communication skills, is result-driven and resourceful. We value the “everything is possible” attitude a lot!


Must-haves



  • Outstanding people and communication skills

  • Self-starter attitude with a hands-on approach, with the ability to drive sales process end-to-end

  • Have experience in cooperation with affiliate networks (eg. Awin, Tradedoubler, Tradetracker )

  • Strong problem-solving and creative commercial approach

  • Be able to work in a cross-functional environment to close new business

  • Be autonomous on top of working with other members of ZIPZERO’s Team


Nice-to-haves



  • Interest in startups, technology, retail

  • Have experience in B2B sales specifically for fintech companies

  • Self-employment


What do we offer?



  • Competitive salary with attractive commission

  • Awesome base-office at WeWork Aviation House in the very center of London

  • Flexible hours, a lot of fieldwork, possibility of working remotely

  • Great team that will teach you and learn from you in a friendly, vibrant atmosphere

  • Challenging project that would calls for a lot of hard but extremely satisfying work

  • Access to London’s startup community, special WeWork networking and events


Apply now – you’re most probably the one we’re looking for!

items.title: Sales Development Representative
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Start date: 19th September (or as soon as possible) 


Location: London or Oxford, open to remote working


Salary: £12 per hour + Commission of £30 per booked customer. 


Hours: 15 hours per week, evenings and weekends.


 


School Space - Why


Like it or not, funding plays a critical role in a schools ability to deliver a great education, and we are unfortunately facing a funding cut crisis in the UK, the scale of which hasn’t been seen since WW2. This is the first problem we’re trying to solve.


Secondly, a recent study (conducted by the Eden project) identified that disconnected communities cost the UK economy over £32 billion/year. Extensive research has concluded that people feel happier, safer and more content when they live in connected communities and know their neighbours. Across the UK, connected communities are simply not happening. This is where School Space comes in. 


School Space - How


Schools have lots of spaces that sit empty on evenings, weekends, and holidays. We work with schools across the South East to help them let their spaces to community groups, which not only increases school income, it also makes affordable spaces available to the locals which in turn helps to build a thriving school at the center of a thriving community.


School Space - Team


Founders James and Jemma have been working on this problem for 7 years, and recent success includes investment raises, 36 partner schools, over half a million generated for them. We’ve been on the Techstars 2018 Cohort, been nominated for Social Enterprise UK’s Social Enterprise of the Year,  and picked up a few awards and amazing networks along the way. Our team are committed to the nth degree and full of the belief that social business is the model of the future. We have endless determination to see School Space grow fast and well, scaling our impact across the UK and beyond. In the mix we have Oxbridge graduates, marathon runners, a pilot, industry veterans, an Olympic torch bearer and a woman who once ran a marathon on a bet. 


The Role - Why


The more community users (those that hire our school spaces) the greater impact we can have - and we need to hire an amazing, motivated person to find and engage them. With every booking you secure, you will make an impact on the education sector (and some commission too..).


The Role - How


Key responsibilities include:



  • Find and qualify new leads through web searches, local meetups, classified ads and community networks

  • Create target lists and prioritise activities

  • Identify the key stakeholders, and organise meetings through calls, emails, and social media 

  • Build relationships with new prospects over the phone or email and demonstrate the value of School Space to them from the first interaction

  • Match prospective customers with the best spaces for them and qualify the opportunity including identifying any key blockers

  • Collaborate with Sales Executives and the Director/co-founder you report into, to convey details of the opportunities and arrange discovery calls or meetings with the prospective leads.

  • Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of qualified opportunities and closed business 

  • Suggest innovative ways to catch customers’ attention and obtain new meetings with them.


What we want from you:



  • Hustle.

  • A track record of high achievement, going above and beyond 

  • Resilience - the ability to persist, overcome objections and engage stakeholders effectively

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills 

  • Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career 

  • The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to constantly improve

  • Natural curiosity with sincere empathy for customers - a people person.

  • The technical aptitude to master our CRM tools

  • A motivation to hit targets and earn commission

  • An eagerness to take on more responsibility, and you thrive on change - we are a start up and that means things are fast moving.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=2, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Business Info Developer Consultant (Remote)- HIVE, SPARK, SQOOP PS20009**Location:** **United States****Requisition #:** PS20009**Post Date:** Jul 31, 2019Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., its a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which were creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.Business Info Developer Consultant (Enterprise HEDIS Team)Location: Work from Home or any Anthem OfficeThe quality data management team ensures the collection, production, and reporting of HEDIS measures and related data. This team also supports clinical data analytics platforms utilized by data scientists. The ideal candidate will support optimizations and enhancements of the HEDIS reporting cycle and support development of expansion and enhancements made to the clinical data analytics platform.Responsibilities will include (1) develop applications to standardize and ETL data; (2) design large scale data analytics and reporting platforms; (3) analyze operational environment and recommend improvements; (4) general oversight of the clinical data analytics platform and codebase; (5) aide in reporting management design and code maintenance; and (6) aide other team members and business partners in report development.Primary Duties includeWriting SQL code for data analysis as well as to expand and maintain our clinical data platform and datasets.Oversight of clinical data platform and its code base.Perform querying optimization, index tuning, and other optimizations to ensure the health of code base and platforms.Develop ETL code and complex procedures relating to data transformation.Develop strategic reporting and data-warehousing applicationsPerform in-depth analysis on operational and infrastructure issues.Work closely with data scientists and other clinical analysts.Demonstrate a willingness to problem solve, collaborate, and think creatively to further server our partners.Qualifications.Requires a BS/BA degree and 3-5 years developer experience, or any combination of education and experience which would provide and equivalent background.Requires healthcare experience and prior knowledge of healthcare data and clinical concepts.3-5 years SQL coding experience. Familiarity with concepts like update, indexes, case statements, joins, subqueries, aggregate functions, etc. is required.Familiarity with relational database environments such as MS SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle required. Experience in distributed environments like Hadoop preferred.Establishes and maintains excellent knowledge of data warehouse database design, data definitions, system capabilities, programming languages, and data integrity issues.Experience with major ETL technologies required, informatica preferred.Experience working with large datasets (10+ TB).HEDIS measure experience.Big Data Experience Preferred. Experience developing in Hadoop preferred.Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of Americas Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.
Associated topics: business, business advisory, business analyst, business intelligence, business systems, consultant, customer, information technology consultant, sap, senior consultant

items.title: Manifold: Director, Ecosystem (Partnership Sales & Management)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director, Ecosystem (Partnership Sales & Management)

At Manifold, we are building a marketplace of cloud-based developer tools and infrastructure services. We are looking for a strong sales/business development/account management professional to help us add more services to the marketplace, grow partnership revenue and help our partners succeed.

We currently have 40+ provider services in our marketplace but we're just getting started. We believe there are thousands of potential partners out there including "tier one" services like Stripe, Twilio, MongoDB, and Fastly all the way down to nascent one-developer services. Your job is to pioneer successful tactics to pursue, secure and manage these partners.

Although we have been doing this for a while, this is a new, dedicated role and a greenfield opportunity: you will define, create, manage and execute the Partnership Management function.

Your compensation will include both a base salary and variable, target-based component.

Responsibilities

  • Add new Service Provider partners to the Manifold Marketplace
  • Assist Exec Team with new Platform Distribution partner opportunities for our Marketplace-as-a-Service
  • Manage the partner pipeline and business development process
  • Manage existing partner accounts with the goal of growing marketplace revenue for each partner
  • Work with Manifold's Growth team on partner-targeted marketing content and programs
  • Act as the primary advocate for our partners' interests within Manifold

Qualifications

  • Strong knowledge of the developer tools/cloud infrastructure space and competitive landscape.
  • A strong network of contacts in the developer tools/cloud infrastructure space.
  • Motivated by a quota-carrying sales role.
  • Pioneer. This is a new role for us. You're comfortable refining the role and related programs as we go.
  • Strong presentation & pitch skills.
  • Strong relationship skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience working remotely/async in a global, distributed team.

items.title: Business Consultant - Insurance - Remote Working - Technology
items.content:
Synchro are proud to be partnering with a renowned technology and data analytics powerhouse and are recruiting exclusively on their behalf for a client facing Business Consultant with claims insurance experience to join the team.

As the Business Consultant you will be responsible for the end to end implementation of a sophisticated and highly sought-after SaaS product suite. This product suite will be delivered into the insurance market; therefore, it is vital you have experience of this sector. You will have overall day-to-day management of multiple implementation projects for new and existing customers within an agreed project schedule and scope and have the flexibility to work from wherever you want. This could be at home, in the office in Sheffield or perhaps a shared office space (this would be paid for).

We are seeking a Business Consultant who would enjoy being involved in wearing multiple hats and would relish the opportunity of traveling throughout the UK to client site, working remotely and freely and on occasion perhaps an international trip away for a couple of days. Our client is on a mission to grow their market share not just in the U.K but also in EMEA.

Other core responsibilities will consist of:

  • Supporting presales
  • Delivering demo's and presentations
  • Requirements capture as well as analysing and documenting client needs
  • Configuration and Implementation of the solution
  • Project management duties
  • Training when required on the product suite

To be considered for the role you will either be a client facing software consultant or an experienced professional with a strong background in insurance. Perhaps operational, supply chain or advisory. The core skills we are looking for are:

  • Background in Claims Insurance
  • Stakeholder management
  • Ability to capture requirements
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at any one time
  • Ability to control a room
  • An interest in solution selling and somebody who would relish being client facing
  • Happy to travel
  • You do not need to understand SaaS or technology. However, an interest in technology would definitely help!

You will be joining a close knit and supportive team consisting of mixed experience and you will have the opportunity to grow across the business.

ROLE: Business Consultant

LOCATION: Remote working

SALARY: Up to £55,000

BENEFITS: 25 days of annual leave, pension scheme, corporate credit card, flexible working environment, working within a collaborative business.

Please contact Ryan James at Synchro to explore this exclusive opportunity further or apply through this job posting and we will be in touch.

Keywords: Business Analyst, Business Systems Analyst, BA, Consultant, Project Manager, Software Delivery, Delivery Consultant, Business Consultant, Delivery Project Manager, software Consultant, Implementation consultant, software consultant, client facing,

Location: Remote Working, Remote, Home working, Sheffield, Manchester, Birmingham, Leeds, UK, West Midlands, Liverpool, Nottingham, Oxford, London, Southampton, Portsmouth, Reading

items.title: Senior Enrollment Eligibility Representative - US Telecommute
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work.

In this position the Senior Enrollment Eligibility Representative will play a key role in responsibilities would be to reconcile membership & provider data to ultimately find the best provider for a member. Day to day activities include but not limited to: data manipulation, reconciliation, system research, and decision making based on analytical findings. Processor will also learn to send member letter correspondence, be expected to work in multiple systems quickly maneuvering between screens, and following up with outside teams on missing data elements. Employees of the PCP Member Linkage team work hand in hand with market managers and UHN submitters to audit provider change submissions prior to processing. Expectation for employees to meet metric goals while maintaining exceptional quality.

Primary Responsibilities:

* Loading new member or group data into the enrollment database & update the database with changes

* Responding to member eligibility or group questions & verify enrollment status

* Working with various types of member correspondence

* Reconciling eligibility discrepancies, analyzing transactional data & submitting retroactive eligibility changes

* Inventory control of member and group transactions

* Working with underwriters and brokers and do the full enrollment process from inquiries to quotes

* Work is frequently completed without established procedures

* Works independently
* May act as a resource for others
* May coordinate others activities

Required Qualifications:

* High School Diploma / GED (or higher)
* 2+ years of experience in an office setting environment using the telephone and computer as the primary instruments to perform job duties

* Moderate proficiency with Windows PC applications, Microsoft Outlook - Navigation, maintain calendar and create email. Microsoft Excel - Navigation, inputting data, formulas, and pivot tables. Microsoft Word - creating documents. Microsoft PowerPoint - creating presentation and inputting data.

* Available to work 8 hours within core business hour

Soft Skills:

* Ability to navigate a computer while on the phone

* Ability to multi-task, this includes ability to understand multiple products and multiple levels of benefits within each product

* Ability to remain focused and productive each day though tasks may be repetitive

* Prior stable work experience

Physical Requirements and Work Environment:

* Frequent speaking, listening using a headset, sitting, use of hands/fingers across keyboard or mouse, handling other objects, long periods working at a computer

* Service center environment with moderate noise level due to Representatives talking, computers, printers, and floor activity

Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 6 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.SM

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Keywords: United Healthcare, UHG, Senior Enrollment Eligibility Representative, enrollment, analyzing

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

items.title: Data Center Business Development Manager , Remote
items.content:
Description The Business Development Manager (BDM) is responsible for pipeline development, managing the entire sales process, and achieving sales goals and objectives for their assigned territory. The BDM will develop and implement a sales strategy to achieve such targets, build and grow client relationships, and execute business development activities within their region. The BDM will collaborate with other team members during new sales pursuits and is responsible for leading these activities internally. They will also participate in the creation of client deliverables including RFP responses and pitches. This is a hunter role with an excellent compensation plan. Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a 4-year college or university and a minimum of 2 -4 years of related Sales/Business Development experience required. Having knowledge or experience with Data Center sales/operations/outsourcing is a plus and preferred. Those with IT sales backgrounds (hardware, services, or other related sales) will be considered. Candidates must have: excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong organizational and analytical skills, solid presentation skills, ability to effectively and efficiently respond to inquiries from clients, co-workers, supervisor, and/or management, in a timely fashion. Being a team player is a requirement! \n\nBachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university required. MBA preferred. Minimum of 5 years of related experience and/or training with a background in finance, consulting, or analytics preferred. Experience must include a minimum of 2 years commercial real estate developing outsourcing solutions, pricing and org development models. Real Estate license preferred. CoreNet membership and participation in local events. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to prepare analytics and reports in a pre-designed style and format. Ability to effectively and efficiently respond to inquiries from clients, co-workers, supervisor, and/or management. Ability to effectively present information. Requires in-depth knowledge of financial terms and principles. Reviews complex financial/business analysis and reports prepared by subordinates. Ability to analyze the most complex business/financial data and develop innovative solutions. Develops and implements financial policies and procedures. Approves and oversees departmental budget. Ability to solve advanced problems and deal with a variety of options in complex situations. Requires expert level analytical and quantitative skills. Technically savvy with solid experience in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) and Outlook. Advanced Excel skills preferred. Experience working with large data sets and decipher multiple types of RFP models preferred. Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.
- provided by Dice

items.title: Business Development Executive - 100% remote - Los Angeles
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Law Firms, Banks, Business Development

If you are a Business Development Executive in the San Francisco Bay area with experience, please read on!

We are a global risk management firm providing companies with an online management system. We offer searching, UCC filing, tracking, monitoring, and portfolio management with our centralized system.

We are looking for a spectacular Business Development Executive to join our team and hit the ground running into one of our newest territories. Although we are growing rapidly throughout the US, this territory has been pretty untouched so it's a huge opportunity for someone to come in and make a huge impact.

What's In It for You

We offer an exciting compensation package including but not limited to:

- A base salary ranging starting at $75K + up to 150K OTE in your first year
- Full comprehensive benefits
- Ability to work 100% remotely
- 401K with match
- Generous PTO / Sick Time

What You Will Be Doing

Creating sales and marketing plans, implements strategies and tactics which will increase our financial and legal client base
Driving transactional revenues of $350,000 or more in a 12-month period
Conducting 6-8 sales meetings a week with clients and prospects and another 6-8 drops to open and close new business opportunities.
Positioning and selling the technology and transactional services into the legal and financial markets and develops strategies to target law firms and financial institutions that we can service based on our existing capabilities.
Building a sales pipeline of national and regional financial institutions and NLJ 250 and regional law firms to ensure a continuous achievement of monthly revenue targets for both corporate transactional revenues and financial revenues.
Documenting all activities in salesforce.com to manage sales activities, follow-ups with clients and prospects and generate reports to reflect quantity and quality of sales activities.
Working collaboratively with marketing to develop detailed sales campaigns which will drive leads and thought leadership in the market.
Continuously updating the VP of Sales on interactions with prospects and clients about the clients evolving needs.
Doing proper handoff of new order placers and clients to the Operations Team to ensure a smooth and productive onboarding experience
Attending and promoting events and tradeshows by reaching out to attendees before the event to drive booth activity.
Taking the lead on building relationships with paralegal associations, other legal associations and financial institution associations to promote our brand and gain new order placers.
Effectively position to prospects and customers in a compelling manner which drives new order placers and new logo acquisitions.

What You Need for this Position

MUST HAVE:

- 5+ Years of experience selling into banks or law firms at an executive level
- Ability to work 100% remotely
- Track record of consistently exceeding revenue targets
- Enjoy the pursuit of new logo acquisition through prospecting, demos, meetings, closing and on-boarding new clients

Nice to have:

- Knowledge of Salesforce.com
- Documented success selling complex SaaS professional products and servicesSo, if you are a Business Development Executive in the San Francisco Bay Area with experience, please apply today OR email me your resume to !

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.title: TaxJar: Program Coordinator
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Program Coordinator

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 20,000 businesses. Founded to help eCommerce merchants spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love, we're passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues.

Our core values
  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 100+ people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for an experienced Program Coordinator to join our Product Engineering team.

We're looking for an entrepreneurial, organized, and analytical program manager that is eager to make an impact on a game-changing product in eCommerce. Someone that has the passion to drive and manage development for TaxJar's strategic product initiatives to drive significant growth and adoption for the business.

On our team you will have the opportunity to define and drive technical delivery for company-wide initiatives. Working with our senior team leaders at TaxJar you will be right in the middle of making eCommerce easier for everyone.

*This is a full-time remote position available to folks located in the US.

As a Program Coordinator for TaxJar you will:

  • Deeply understand the needs and desires of merchants, developers, and CPAs who collect and remit sales tax.
  • Lead alignment on vision, scope, success criteria definition, release planning, and communications for large and strategic cross-squad development initiatives
  • Drive product development through the entire development cycle, from conceptualization, design and development, through to launch and ongoing support in a fast-paced, agile environment
  • Manage organization-wide development to program schedules. Work with teams to ensure everyone is on-track to reach their assigned goals
  • Provide communications and visibility to cross-squad status (e.g. priorities, key decisions, release/production issues, dependencies, risks, metrics, milestones, etc.) on an ongoing basis through proactive status reporting and updates to all stakeholders and cross-functional team members
  • Support documentation, training, and troubleshooting issues alongside the product manager and engineers
  • Bring new perspectives on how we can improve our product to better serve our customers, while ensuring we stay true to our focus, core values and mission.
  • Be comfortable with ambiguity, have strong attention to detail, and be excited to work in a fully-distributed environment with multiple teams.
REQUIREMENTS

  • 3 - 6 years of project/program management experience with an agile SaaS product, preferably in small business, payroll or taxes
  • Experience in project planning and implementation of cross-team initiatives
  • Data driven, with strong problem framing and analytical skills. You must be able to properly frame and size complex problems, then break them down into actionable steps
  • Creative problem-solver with a passion for making complex things simple(r)
  • Strong interpersonal skills; you will need to develop strong relationships with developers, customer success, sales and marketing team members, state employees, and stressed-out customers
  • You have the perfect combination of patience and an intense bias for action
  • Superior attention to detail, with strong process and documentation skills
  • Experience with software planning tools and/or project management tools
  • Proactive and superstar communicator, with the ability to speak and write clearly and concisely
  • Self-directed, self-motivated and an evangelizer of action within the organization
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (Basecamp, chat, zoom, email, etc)

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k Plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: Trainee Account Executive - Influencer Marketing
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re Tailify — awarded Europe’s best influencer marketing agency in 2019. They told us influencer marketing couldn’t work. But since 2013, we’ve been shaking up the media landscape with our simple, data-driven solution to connect advertisers with social influencers. The result? High-impact content, powerful partnerships and multiple awards. Great ideas can come from anywhere, and at Tailify we let everyone hold the mic. You’ll get real responsibility in an exciting, entrepreneurial environment with big global clients and plenty of room to grow. We think media land should have a wider horizon. Come and join a real game-changer and be part of something unstoppable.


A day in the life of a Trainee Account Executive 


You’ll work closely with some of the most powerful influencers in the world to deliver high-impact influencer marketing campaigns for global brands and agencies in the smoothest way possible. You will be involved in influencer selection and negotiation, content creation and campaign reporting. You will be the contact for our influencers to make sure they deliver top quality content on time.


Responsibilities include:



  • Offering the best service to clients and influencers

  • Influencer research and outreach (should we need to go outside of our network)

  • Working with our business development team to provide influencer research for sales proposals

  • Managing content approvals via our platform, quality checking and ensuring content meets the clients brief

  • Creating influencer briefs 

  • Negotiating influencer prices

  • Assisting with campaign reports

  • Supporting the team to deliver high quality work to all our clients


You’re good at:



  • Offering exceptional service 

  • Demonstrating your knowledge of and passion for influencer marketing - we are looking for someone entrepreneurial who wants to become an influencer marketing expert

  • Being a keen social media user, following influencers and forward thinking brands. 

  • Keeping yourself and others on-track and organised

  • Communicating confidently (both written and verbal) with a ‘can do’ attitude


Working with us means…



  • Working with high profile brands like L’Oréal, Coca-Cola and Universal not to mention some of the most high-profile influencers.

  • Joining ‘the startup most likely to revolutionise the media industry’ (Starcom MediaVest).

  • Enjoying every moment with a sociable bunch from all over the world.


The cherry on top



  • Holiday: 23 days plus bank holidays

  • Equipment: Your own MacBook, screen and a phone bill allowance (plus all the tech tools you could ever need)

  • Flexibility: Enjoy work-from-home Wednesdays 

  • Health: A £30 monthly wellness allowance which can go towards gym membership

  • Office: New WeWork office space with beer and prosecco on tap

  • Socials: Monthly out-of-office activities and our incredible summer party on the Thames!

items.title: Sales Executive / Business Development Manager (FinTech with Stock Options)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sales Executive / Business Development Manager (London FinTech with Stock Options)


About Expend


We’re a fast-growing London-based FinTech startup (Top 100 Britain's Fastest-Growing Businesses).


Our product simplifies the painful business expenses process with a unique software platform and smart company card. We save companies time, hassle and money, which provides them a new level of expense automation and efficient control over budgets and employee spending.


We are working in a huge sector mainly dominated by big businesses using outdated approaches. The opportunity to grow Expend and drive change in this space is huge.


We’re an ambitious team and have set ourselves a number of goals, but our first challenge is to revolutionise business expenses.


Overview


We are looking for a driven sales person who isn’t afraid to learn new skills, get on the phone to promote our product, host demonstration calls and chase up clients, to join our team in London. You will be working across various disciplines, including sales, marketing and operations, as well as spending time with the development team to understand our service.


The role encompasses the following:



  • Communicating with and promoting our service/product to potential customers

  • Researching potential customers to drive new business

  • Following up with customers by email or phone call

  • Developing relationships with potential partners

  • Working in the sales team to streamline sales processes

  • Achieving KPI's, revenue and other targets

  • Attending events and networking in London and potentially across the UK

  • Other suitable work dependant on skills


Qualifications


The “Ideal” Candidate:



  • Previous experience in digital/SaaS sales

  • Ability to work to and exceed targets

  • A degree in a relevant field of study

  • Personable and strong communication skills

  • Passionate, fun and have the entrepreneurial flare to build your own client base

  • Engaging phone manner

  • Clear and persuasive communicator

  • Ability to build rapport with potential new clients as well as strong relationships internally

  • Desire to succeed and improve your skills

  • High proficiency in English


Bonus Points



  • Experience with CRM systems and software such as Intercom, Hubspot or other marketing & sales automation software

  • Experience in the finance sector


Additional Information:


Alongside a competitive salary, there will be incentives based on performance, including company stock options.


Our office is based in an amazing vibrant space in Finsbury Square.


Given the fast pace of a growing technology company. There will be opportunities to perform other suitable work dependent on skills (we actively promote employees to broaden their skill set).


This is an opportunity to be part of a talented and ambitious team. We’re a friendly company, and we aim to create an enjoyable work environment, with work that is challenging but rewarding.


If you think you would be a valuable addition to our team and wish to explore this opportunity, we look forward to hearing from you.


Please send your CV and covering letter. Applications without a covering letter will not be considered.


No remote workers. No recruiters, agencies or service providers. High proficiency in English essential.
