items.title: Sales Development Representative
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sales Development Representative at Host Compliance

Remote
Sales Development Representative (SDR)

Flexibility to work from regional home office. (Must reside within US or Canada)

About You

Are you known around your circle as a highly motivated individual with the ability to build rapport and make friends quickly? Are you proactive and passionate about making an impact? Looking to get your foot in the door to an exciting, fast-paced software company?

About the Position

SDRs are the first live face or voice of our brand – so we are looking for a seasoned, obsessively detail oriented, and technology savvy professional who demonstrates exceptional active listening and communication skills. In joining our rapidly growing local government SaaS startup you will need to become immersed in the short-term vacation rental phenomenon so you can quickly talk to it’s challenges to city leaders across North America. Your proficiency in Salesforce and online research will allow you to quickly find and identify the decision makers of municipalities to speak to.

You’ll be working with a team of SDRs and driving execution of marketing designed campaigns, making A LOT of phone calls (40-60 or more per day) and sending tons of emails, following up promptly when planners, code enforcement, tax collectors or city managers inquire about our services. If the lead is qualified, you’ll then book a meeting for our Account Executives to go over the services and purchasing steps in greater detail. At this time, you’ll then log the appropriate tasks in the system and carry on with your call list.

You’ll also provide feedback to the SDR Lead on what is working and what needs improvement, whether related to the call down lists, messaging and systems to improve the team’s success.

We stress that SDRs are expected to sell the meeting, not the product – your position is critical in helping to demonstrate the value of the solution and the meeting. You need to be extremely adept at following workflows and processes for A/B testing and welcome change while offering feedback as we work to improve for optimal success. You’ll also participate in daily team meetings and attend offsites with the whole team.

This role can be performed from home as long as you have access to a professional work environment and a fast internet connection.

Personality
  • Passion for technology and becoming an expert in your field
  • Entrepreneurial at heart and ability to flourish in a fast-paced, start-up environment
  • You naturally share ideas and never lose sight that you are part of a team
  • Comfortable at building relationships with clients over the phone and over email
  • Enthusiasm for change and a drive for innovation
  • Love working systematically and following detailed procedures
  • Keeps track of critical details and maintains quality control
  • Adept at performing routine work and checking data for accuracy
  • Enjoy sticking to a strict schedule and keeping organized
Required
  • 1+ years previous SDR experience
  • 1+ years experience with Salesforce.com
  • 1+ years sales experience at a SaaS or Enterprise Software company
  • Stellar computer and internet skills
  • Excellent grammar and spelling
  • Engaging verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to train, motivate and provide direction
Bonus Points for
  • Salesloft experience
  • Local government experience
  • Bachelor’s degree or Diploma (Sales or Marketing preferred, also accepting part-time students in similar programs)
Hiring Process

We have thought a lot about who fits well on the team, and designed a unique process to help highlight a great fit. We care a lot about innate skills, attitudes and work-ethic. Our hiring process reflect this, and to find the perfect candidate we will test every candidate on the actual skills required to do the job successfully. Each test will require only a small time commitment from you, and we will only ask you to do additional tests if you pass the prior tests. This way we won’t waste your time while making sure that you are the perfect match for the job.

About Host Compliance

Host Compliance is a privately held tech company. Our vision is a world in which the sharing economy works for everyone. We seek to contribute to this by being the leading independent and trusted third party that local governments can turn to for data, tools and impartial advice on how to adopt and enforce Airbnb-style short-term rental related regulations that best serve the needs of all constituents in their communities. You can learn more about us from these new stories in the Wall Street Journal, CNN and Fox News.

The team behind Host Compliance consist of an experienced group of data scientists, engineers and business people with backgrounds from Caltech, Harvard and McKinsey. The company is profitable and it has grown extremely rapidly since launching out of Stealth mode in Q2 2016.

Apply Now

Come join us! If you’re up for unlimited career growth opportunities and a career-changing role, we’d love to chat! Please include in your application your resume, references and a cover letter demonstrating why you’d be a great fit for Host Compliance.

Please complete the applicant form (select the Apply button) to apply. Only candidates selected for an interview will be notified.

HOST COMPLIANCE, LLC

1037 NE 65th St #81158

Seattle, WA 98115

Location: US or Canada Only

Apply for job

items.content:
We're hiring employees number 4 and 5to work on business development / sales (whichever word doesn’t make youcringe!) and new clients. We are a brand new Cambridge-based commercial teamwho has just raised Seed, and we’re growing our user base 10-20% month overmonth. You’ll be a Commercial Account Executive, working with the ChiefCommercial Officer and sometimes (which means “often”) directly with the CEO.You’ll help new clients understand the business and our technology, and how itsolves the problems they’re having with personal data, general innovation, andAI. Come on board if you want to pull weight at one of the most interestingyoung technology companies to come out of Cambridge.


Specific Duties and Responsibilities

Commercial Account Management

We’re a brand new technology, and our clients need time and support to understand what we can do for their business (which is a lot). You’ll help them understand everything we do, and how it helps them with their technology innovation, digital transformation, personal data, and AI.

Sales

We support and work with real big global clients and real small local startups, and your job is to offer something to all of them. You’ll build out an exceptional network doing this job, and if you’re amazing at the communications and followup bits of account management you’ll have a huge impact here. Everyone will want to be your friend, because you’re going to be friends with all our clients!

Growth Sprints

DataSwift is developing a growth and marketing engine targeting developers, startups, and other fast-growing businesses alongside (and during) your work. You’re going to help with this as well - you will contribute weekly to the business development and marketing sprints, working with the CCO (me) to develop a scalable engine of growth. If Eric Ries said it, we’re doing it.

External Comms

You will be the first point of contact for all of our new and existing business. We’re depending on you.

Reporting and Insights

We track our business development accurately and do a great job refining our pipelines down until they sing sea shanties. You’re going to be the ultimate authority on exactly how much business we’re doing and how we could be doing more.


Skills, Qualifications and Experiences:

Communications – you are joining an elite (*buffs nails*) team of early business-side startuppers, working on the hardest job in startups: early-stage growth. Good, no, great communication is essential. If you’ve never worked in startups before that’s ok too - we’ll teach you everything you need to know. Which reminds me…

Learning - very, very few people have elite-level experience in high-growth startups. If you do (awesome, come work with us!!) you know that learning is a huge part of the job. If you don’t this is going to be a place where you can pick up hundreds if not thousands of new skills, and really stretch your abilities. Sound fun?

Customer relations – you can talk to anyone; no, not in that fake, salesman-y sort of way but in the way that suits you. You are diligent about communications, you want to deeply help and understand your customers, and you care. You got this.

Time management – we have too much to do, and you will too. If you can work well under pressure and manage your time and tasks efficiently, you’re going to love it here.

Executive support – you know everything there is to know about being helpful. You probably really like being helpful. I mean, being helpful is awesome, why wouldn’t you?


What’s in it for you:

This is an entry-level role paying £20,000-30,000 a year, and you’ll earn equity as well. You’ll work in a fast-paced environment with a lot of flexibility, and you can more or less work as remotely as you like. You’ll get some expenses covered, you’ll have lot’s of opportunities for advancement, and you’ll be joining us right after we’ve raised Seed (and before Series A), which is almost the perfect time to join a young Startup. You’ll have a lot of responsibilities and you’ll learn a ton.

The pitch from us:

This is a chance to work on the most important problems in tech: data problems. You can fix Cambridge Analytica and help pioneer the future of the digital economy.

You'll work with a young, driven growth team with a range of skills. You can also help shape that team, as we're still small and are building our internal culture.

We have good flexibility. We can foster remote working and we have family-friendly setups and understanding for our teams. We're very international as well, with team members from Canada, the UK, Malaysia, Greece, and Germany.

Things are going to move quickly here, and your personal development is one of our big focuses, and so is the development of our team as we onboard our new customers. You're joining the company right at Seed stage - so stable enough to be responsible, but young enough for there still to be lots of responsibility to go around.

We cultivate a culture of open-mindedness and flexibility with discipline and hard work. On top of a competitive salary, you get financial perks like equity, and the responsibilities of leadership. We're building a representative team and you'll work under one of the highest-paid female academics and CEOs in the UK. Hope you can join us.

Oh, and I'm Jonathan, by the way. Great to meet you.

items.title: Host Compliance: Sales Development Representative
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sales Development Representative

Sales Development Representative (SDR)

Flexibility to work from regional home office. (Must reside within US or Canada)

About You

Are you known around your circle as a highly motivated individual with the ability to build rapport and make friends quickly? Are you proactive and passionate about making an impact? Looking to get your foot in the door to an exciting, fast-paced software company?

About the Position

SDRs are the first live face or voice of our brand - so we are looking for a seasoned, obsessively detail oriented, and technology savvy professional who demonstrates exceptional active listening and communication skills. In joining our rapidly growing local government SaaS startup you will need to become immersed in the short-term vacation rental phenomenon so you can quickly talk to it’s challenges to city leaders across North America. Your proficiency in Salesforce and online research will allow you to quickly find and identify the decision makers of municipalities to speak to.

You’ll be working with a team of SDRs and driving execution of marketing designed campaigns, making A LOT of phone calls (40-60 or more per day) and sending tons of emails, following up promptly when planners, code enforcement, tax collectors or city managers inquire about our services. If the lead is qualified, you'll then book a meeting for our Account Executives to go over the services and purchasing steps in greater detail. At this time, you'll then log the appropriate tasks in the system and carry on with your call list.
You'll also provide feedback to the SDR Lead on what is working and what needs improvement, whether related to the call down lists, messaging and systems to improve the team's success.

We stress that SDRs are expected to sell the meeting, not the product - your position is critical in helping to demonstrate the value of the solution and the meeting. You need to be extremely adept at following workflows and processes for A/B testing and welcome change while offering feedback as we work to improve for optimal success. You’ll also participate in daily team meetings and attend offsites with the whole team.

This role can be performed from home as long as you have access to a professional work environment and a fast internet connection.

Personality

  • Passion for technology and becoming an expert in your field
  • Entrepreneurial at heart and ability to flourish in a fast-paced, start-up environment
  • You naturally share ideas and never lose sight that you are part of a team
  • Comfortable at building relationships with clients over the phone and over email
  • Enthusiasm for change and a drive for innovation
  • Love working systematically and following detailed procedures
  • Keeps track of critical details and maintains quality control
  • Adept at performing routine work and checking data for accuracy
  • Enjoy sticking to a strict schedule and keeping organized

Required

  • 1+ years previous SDR experience
  • 1+ years experience with Salesforce.com
  • 1+ years sales experience at a SaaS or Enterprise Software company
  • Stellar computer and internet skills
  • Excellent grammar and spelling
  • Engaging verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to train, motivate and provide direction

Bonus Points for

  • Salesloft experience
  • Local government experience
  • Bachelor’s degree or Diploma (Sales or Marketing preferred, also accepting part-time students in similar programs)

Hiring Process

We have thought a lot about who fits well on the team, and designed a unique process to help highlight a great fit. We care a lot about innate skills, attitudes and work-ethic. Our hiring process reflect this, and to find the perfect candidate we will test every candidate on the actual skills required to do the job successfully. Each test will require only a small time commitment from you, and we will only ask you to do additional tests if you pass the prior tests. This way we won’t waste your time while making sure that you are the perfect match for the job.

About Host Compliance

Host Compliance is a privately held tech company. Our vision is a world in which the sharing economy works for everyone. We seek to contribute to this by being the leading independent and trusted third party that local governments can turn to for data, tools and impartial advice on how to adopt and enforce Airbnb-style short-term rental related regulations that best serve the needs of all constituents in their communities. You can learn more about us from these new stories in the Wall Street Journal, CNN and Fox News.

The team behind Host Compliance consist of an experienced group of data scientists, engineers and business people with backgrounds from Caltech, Harvard and McKinsey. The company is profitable and it has grown extremely rapidly since launching out of Stealth mode in Q2 2016.

Apply Now

Come join us! If you’re up for unlimited career growth opportunities and a career-changing role, we’d love to chat! Please include in your application your resume, references and a cover letter demonstrating why you’d be a great fit for Host Compliance.

Please complete the applicant form (select the Apply button) to apply. Only candidates selected for an interview will be notified.

HOST COMPLIANCE, LLC

1037 NE 65th St #81158

Seattle, WA 98115

items.title: DataCamp: Enterprise Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Enterprise Account Executive

About the Role
As the Enterprise Account Executive, you will help DataCamp continue its incredible growth trajectory and establish DataCamp as the data science education platform for the world’s leading companies, helping them drive data literacy programs to upskill their workforce.

Leveraging your past success selling solutions to large, enterprise-level accounts, you will build a portfolio of business helping organizations solve their data science skills gap.

This is a remote position in the United States or London and requires 8+ years of business development experience with a track record of quota-exceeding success building a portfolio of business consisting primarily of large, enterprise-level accounts.

You’re the type of person who:
  • Enjoys working and closing large, strategic sales opportunities
  • Excels in consultative selling with multiple stakeholders or buyers
  • Is organized, entrepreneurial and comfortable in a fast-paced environment
  • Thrives on the freedom and accountability of leading your portion of the business
  • Takes pride in everything you deliver as a reflection of yourself
It’s a plus if:
You have expertise in selling data and/or education technology to C-level executives

How you’ll ramp up in the first 90 days:
In the first week you will:

  •   Onboard and integrate into DataCamp
  •  Learn our value proposition and compelling story
  • Learn our sales methodology, collateral and selling process
  • In the first month you will:
  • Build your target portfolio and portfolio strategy geared towards learning & development executives and chief data officers in enterprise-level accounts
  •  Begin to meet with prospects, articulate our value proposition, and work with existing DataCamp users to persuade decision makers
  • In the first three months you will:
  • Begin to negotiate and close contracts
  • Continue to expand your portfolio and accelerate growth in existing accounts
What is in it for you?
  • A role at the center of the commercial business of a fast growing SAAS scale-up
  • A competitive salary including fringe benefits
  • Stock options
  • Flexible hours
  • International company retreats every year
  • Work with a great team (everyone says this, but we’re serious—we’re pretty great)
 DataCamp is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

items.content:
Business Development Associate at Human Made

Remote
Business Development Associate

We are looking to expand our Business Development capacity to help support our Sales Team. Business Development at Human Made is a role that focuses primarily on driving new business for our newly-released product, Altis. This is a remote role, though we are looking for someone in either the Europe, Middle-East or Asia, specifically in the following cities, or who is regularly able to travel to these cities:

Europe: Oslo, Copenhagen, London, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Zurich, Amsterdam, Warsaw, Vienna, Manchester, Paris, Dubai, Stockholm

Middle-East: Dubai

Asia: Singapore, Tokyo, Seoul, Hong Kong, Taipei

You will be working in the enterprise B2B industry helping us sell Altis, a next-level Digital Experience Platform rooted in open source, WordPress. You will be one of the first hires in helping drive this new product at Human Made; a product we have been working on for the past two years, but has already taken off the ground with clients like Red Bull Media House and Siemens. It’s a really exciting and challenging role!

You will be working closely with Sales, Accounts, Marketing, Design & Product to help increase Altis market share. You will also need to understand the professional services we offer at Human Made, and help our Account Directors in filling regional development allocations by bringing in new prospects & leads. As a new Business Development hire, you are the second Business Development employee so you will have the opportunity to bring a lot of your own suggestions, experiments and experience to help shape our client acquisition pipeline. You will also have a lot of responsibility in helping us implement new process, and validating Business Development inside of Human Made. As a Business Development Associate, you will be joining our Sales team working alongside our Regional Sales Managers, Business Development Manager, and Director of Sales.

Human Made is a remote company. In the role of Business Development Associate, this means that you will need to be adept at communicating in a clear and timely way with colleagues and clients using a broad range of technologies. You’ll be sensitive to the challenges of dealing with teams distributed across different time zones, cultures, and business contexts, many of whom have English as a second or third language. You can work in a self-directed manner, addressing problems as they come up, and identifying issues in your area of work and fixing them. You will need to prioritise your tasks and be confident about speaking up to ask for help when you need it.

In your day to day role you will be involved with:
  • Creating new revenue opportunities by educating our prospects about open source, digital experiences and the advantages Altis offers.
  • You will be expected to fill a quota in terms of outreach, and new opportunities.
  • Using various tools to research countries and territories to determine market size, and create smart lead lists sorted by relevance and audience profile.
  • Converting prospects from these lists into qualified leads for the sales team, through a variety of efforts; e-mails, newsletters, white papers, etc.
  • Managing the Business Development part of the CRM, and following up on leads.
  • Collaborating with Marketing to implement and execute a successful content distribution plan.
  • Market research, working alongside Design & Product to refine our Ideal Client Profile.
  • Client events; working with Marketing & Design to help organise events for clients and prospects.
  • Qualifying prospects’ needs and effectively mapping them to Human Made’s (Altis) offerings.
  • Attending client meetings with Sales.
  • Looking for new channels that can help drive sales and brand awareness.
  • Experimenting and finding new ways to grow our business.
REQUIREMENTS
  • 1-2 years of Business Development experience in a B2B industry, ideally software (SaaS or PaaS).
  • At least 5 years of overall work experience.
  • 1-2 years of experience working with Salesforce.
  • Background, or acquired understanding of technology professional services and/ or SaaS product sector.
  • Marketing/Sales experience in WordPress/SaaS industry is also beneficial.
  • Fluent or near-fluent English language knowledge (written & oral)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both internally and with prospects.
  • You should be comfortable making decisions based upon partial information, leaning upon good intuition and judgement, and be able to bring the team along with you.
  • Excellent organisational skills, time management, and attention to detail.
  • Strong analytical skills, and an ability to measure and optimise your Business Development impact.
  • The ability to write clear and engaging reports internally presenting campaign results to the whole company.
  • Strong self-motivation and discipline to push outreach campaigns independently.
  • To be able to handle rejection from prospects, and persevere with outreach.
  • The drive to experiment repeatedly, and learn from experiments.
  • Thinking on your feet, and being able to solve problems independently and creatively.
BENEFITS
  • £30,000 – £35,000 GBP or local equivalent
  • Flexible working
  • 52 weeks parental leave
  • Generous holiday policy
  • Sickness and carers leave
  • Annual company retreat (Previous retreats have been in Sri Lanka, Italy, Slovakia, Spain, Norway)
  • Conference and training budget
  • Monthly remote working allowance
  • Work wherever you want
  • New computer and mobile phone
  • Office equipment when you need it

Location: Europe, Middle-East, Asia

Apply for job

items.title: B2B / Business Writers wanted!
items.content:
B2B / Business Writers wanted!

Company: Fortis Agency
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

Hi, we are looking for freelance writers who can write blog posts in the business niche. This will be an ongoing gig for multiple writers as we always need fresh content.

Topics we cover usually range between small business, entrepreneurship, startups, career, productivity, collaboration, management, work culture, leadership, business tools, remote work, etc. 

Here are some topic examples: 

Three Ways Cloud Solutions Can Benefit Your Workplace Collaboration
How to Streamline Your Project Management Process

If you think you can write about such topics, let us know. 

We can pay $40-$50 per article.

Articles that we need are about 1,000 - 1,500 words long. The majority of the articles are informative “how-to” blog posts.

Ideal writers for our team:

  • Are experienced in writing professionally in the business niche
  • Are native English speakers with excellent writing skills
  • Have a portfolio of the published content
  • Have a 3-4 day turnaround for articles
  • Can write at least 2 articles per week (for great fit writers we have more work)

When applying, please include:

  • Links to most relevant business blog posts you’ve published (send us some samples)
  • Your expertise: business topics you are most qualified to tackle

We hope for a long term partnership!

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply via email ([email protected]) using the subject line "Business Writer – your name”.

items.title: Business Development (Software/SaaS)

items.content:
About us


Crozdesk.com runs software marketplaces and comparison sites helping businesses globally decide on which software solutions to use. From CRM to Accounting and Marketing to Supply Chain Management - we cover 100s of categories and compare almost everything! Our vendor solutions portal helps thousands of software companies connect with their ideal customers - which will be the focus of a new BD team we're building.


If you like a collaborative and productive environment in which responsibilities are shared and where you'll come in contact with all aspects of the business over time, you'll fit right in. 


We have a small and dynamic team that's distributed globally with our main office base in Shoreditch, London - which is where you will be located as an inside BD Associate.


 


Your role


We are looking for a proactive and results-oriented business developer, who will flourish in our hands-on startup environment. We value smarts and a go-getting attitude over experience, but some knowledge of the business software market and B2B sales would be ideal. This role is right for you, if you are looking to learn and grow as part of a dynamic team that always tries to find the smartest solution to each problem.


You will work with software companies across 100s of industries globally, will learn how to help our clients increase business, how to become a productivity machine and generate quality software sales pipeline that converts. With the right mindset, you will make your mark in this role and will rapidly be able to increase your responsibilities and share in the success of our business.


 


Responsibilities


- End-to-end sales pipeline management


- Close enterprise deals and become an industry expert in B2B software lead generation


- Actively on-board new clients, build and manage customer relationships


- Meet sales targets and ensure customer satisfaction


On a daily basis you will:


- Schedule and conduct consultative calls with software vendors


- Create engaging and attractive customer success stories by building and fostering long-term relationships via email, video chat and calls


- Manage our CRM, follow-up on deals and re-engage prospects


- Optimise existing sales efforts and our operational strategy with an analytical view on how to make the most out of data


- Work alongside CEO, CTO, COO and other colleagues to coordinate efforts to minimise manual work along the sales pipeline and improve sales conversions


- Help out other team members when needed to make sure all operations are running smoothly


 


Requirements:


- 2+ years of sales experience (experienced candidates can be considered for more senior roles)


- A keen understanding of the SaaS or software market


- Excellent written and verbal communication skills


- The ability to foster and grow client relationships


- Experience working with CRMs, planning and implementing sales strategies and dealing with B2B clients


- Experience working with large datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, etc)


- Experience within a B2B environment and/or startup


- A Bachelor's degree or above with a demonstrable interest in business, technology, statistics or analytics (ideally)


- Good technical acumen (bonus)


 


Crozdesk offers competitive base salaries, commissions (uncapped), stock options and pension benefits - all of which will scale with the impact you have on our business. Your salary will depend on your level of experience and overall skillset:


 


Base Salary: £25K – £40K        OTE: £50K – £80K        Stock Options: Depending on Exp.


 


Our recruitment process comprises of four stages: CV screening shortlist, telephone call, optional work sample, face-to-face meeting, optional followup, if everything goes well.


 


Join us at Crozdesk and become part of our fast-paced, close-knit team in a flexible role with plenty of responsibilities and room for growth!

items.title: Polinode: Enterprise Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Enterprise Account Executive

Who We Are?
Polinode is a SaaS company that provides both large enterprises and consultants to enterprises with tools to visualize and analyze the informal relationships (i.e. who works with whom) within organisations. We work at the cutting edge of a space called organizational network analysis and are proud to call some of the largest and most innovative companies in the world as well as over 20 of the most forward-thinking consulting organizations our clients. 

Within enterprises we often work directly with People Analytics teams to support applications such as: identifying cultural influencers, change management, succession planning, supporting collaboration, addressing overload and understanding / improving diversity and inclusion. Our mission is to improve the way that organisations function and to help drive positive change. 

About the Role
We have been experiencing particularly strong growth and are looking for an experienced SaaS Account Executive based in the United States. The role will be broad and, at least initially, will encompass business development, enterprise sales and ongoing sales / account management to both our existing customer base as well as new customers. We are a remote first company - you may be based anywhere in the United States.  

Some More About What You Will Do
• You'll become proficient in Polinode software and solutions and will sell new customers our cloud-based software, including effectively demoing the product via video conference
• Develop strategic prospecting and sales plans/activities to close deals with Enterprise and Consulting prospects
• Follow-up with leads and prospects as well as attend a handful of carefully targeted US trade shows each year
• Manage complex sales cycles and negotiate win-win agreements based on value-based selling
• Build and deepen relationships with existing customers to help us grow into new organizations and to deliver more value to existing customers
• Influence long-term strategic direction and serve as a business partner
• Work with both existing Polinode consulting Partners as well as internal Polinode professional services where appropriate to deliver for our customers

What We are Looking For
• A minimum of 5 years experience selling SaaS to enterprises, preferably in the HR Technology / People Analytics space
• A proven track record of consistently exceeding quota
• Skilled in virtual presentations, online web demos and remote sales processes
• An independent self-starter, preferably with experience working remotely
• Proficiency using Salesforce
• Integrity and success selling over multiple years to customers that trust and respect you
• Impeccable written and verbal communication skills. You are a strong listener and communicator. Since we are a remote team this is even more important than would otherwise be the case.
• Able to thrive in a startup environment— you move quickly and think strategically
• A passion for people and analytics

Why Work with Us?
Organizational network analysis is an exciting and rapidly growing space and Polinode is at the cutting edge of this space! We think you will love the kinds of things that we work on, the solutions that we provide and the people that you will be working with. You will have a lot of independence and a very broad role. We think you will find our compensation structure and benefits package competitive. We are not solely about work though and are all about reasonable working hours, ample vacation time, wellness and interests outside of work. 

We encourage candidates from all different backgrounds and identities to apply. We are always eager to further diversify our company. Polinode is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

We will not accept or review any CV’s from external recruitment agencies.

items.title: Business Development Manager - Proptech
items.content:
Are you a London based Lettings Agent who is ambitious and seeking an exciting opportunity with a technology start up company? With experience in residential lettings you will enjoy uncapped commission, a realistic OTE of £80,000, car allowance, life insurance, pension and more benefits of working for a fast growing multinational technology company.


We are seeking a field based Business Development Manager to generate new business and achieve sales targets through the identification and development of new customers within the residential lettings market. This opportunity would suit a self-motivated driven closer with great influencing skills and ability to generate leads, both warm and cold. To be successful in this role you will need to be able to effectively utilise your excellent communication and technical skills and have demonstrated proven success in building rapport and high trust with clients. You will be known for possessing high standards of integrity. The nature of the role and the region requires an entrepreneurial mindset and someone who can work remotely.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:




  • Achieving and exceeding challenging revenue targets and sales objectives


  • Cold call prospective customers by phone and in person

  • Build sales pipeline, implement sales activity plans with the utilisation of our gated sales process

  • Develop and articulate an effective sales proposition


  • Demonstrate and present benefits of the software system at both conferences and client meetings



  • Develop and maintain improved sales strategies to manage accounts efficiently



  • Create a strategic account plan for all of your target accounts, including organisation profile and contacts by department


  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive customer database in NetSuite and maintain up to date customer meeting and activity records

  • Prepare and deliver regular sales reports and management information as required

  • Participate in sales and corporate events and campaigns as necessary


KEY QUALIFICATIONS:




  • 3 years’ experience in a sales role at a real estate agency



  • Having managed and delivered in excess of £5m sales per annum



  • Have targeted and opened accounts to generate significant levels of new business



  • Ability to conduct effective research proactively



  • Possess a self-motivated and disciplined approach to achieve results



  • Enthusiastic, competitive, results-driven and solutions-orientated with a strong work ethic, high levels of confidence and integrity



  • Possess a valid UK driving license



  • IT skills particularly in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)



 


Your training will be extensive, preparing you for the future and developing your understanding of all aspects of our products and services. Your personal development will be ongoing, both during the company’s evolution and beyond. We believe in nurturing our most important asset, identifying our employee’s ambitions and promoting from within whenever possible. The role will be fast paced, offering you the opportunity to be pro-active in your business development, resulting in much shared success. This is an opportunity to join a fast growing multinational technology company developing business in a new region you can make your own, if you have an entrepreneurial mindset and strong sales drive apply today.

items.title: Grow My Cleaning Company: Enrollment Coach for High Ticket Phone Sales
items.content:
Enrollment Coach for High Ticket Phone Sales

We have HUNDREDS of inbound requests for help every month and need caring and coachable people to enroll the RIGHT clients into our service offering. You will have appointments set for you with pre qualified leads who want and need our help. Your job is to help them! 

You MUST care about serving entrepreneurs, have HUGE integrity, and be coachable! You also must be the type of person who loves to take responsibility for their own results, does the right thing (always) and flat out gets things DONE!

You will earn $1,000 (plus bonuses) per enrollment and will be required to enroll at least (8) clients/ mo. This is a full time, remote, commission only, results based opportunity to work with a group of people who LOVE to have FUN while they serve BIG!

If this scratches where you itch- apply now before life gets in the way an you miss out on the best paying job you will ever LOVE!

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
Sales Development Representative at Dotscience

Remote | International

REMOTE · California, United States · Sales · SDR-01

DESCRIPTION

NOTE: This role is remote-only, and you need to be living in, and have a right to work in, one of the following countries: USA, UK, Germany, France or Ireland. We are mostly based in the UK however, we are growing a small team of Sales and Product staff in California.

About Dotscience

Dotscience is a startup founded in 2017 and funded by DDN, the world’s largest privately-held storage company.

Our mission is to build an end-to-end data science platform that holds AI accountable for its decision making.

We work across the UK and USA as a fully-distributed team, collaborating through GitHub, Slack, Google Hangouts and Google Docs.

We are focused on bringing trusted AI to the most ambitious and impactful companies on the planet today, allowing them to innovate safely and rapidly.

We are looking for a Sales Development Representative who can help us build meaningful relationships with the biggest names in AI, seeking out pilot and sales opportunities, and representing our mission of making AI development safe and efficient. This will involve in-depth profiling and networking with a limited number of companies. We have a small but wonderful team of sales representatives who you will work with, and an awesome sales coach who you will get access to in weekly sales coaching workshops.

The role is salaried, not commission based.

Aims of the position

  • Reach out to potential customers and partners who have never engaged with Dotscience i.e., cold prospecting.
  • Nurture leads who have shown interest in our solution and have already engaged with Dotscience through its marketing channels.

Core job description

Your day-to-day tasks are likely to require you to:

  • Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities
  • Contact potential prospects through cold calls and emails
  • Present our company to potential prospects
  • Identify prospect’s needs and suggest appropriate products/services
  • Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects
  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
  • Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers and Sales Executives
  • Report to the rest of the Sales team on sales pipeline status

REQUIREMENTS

  • Proven work experience as a Sales Development Representative, Sales Account Executive or similar role
  • Experience in a technical role
  • Experience in the data science industry
  • Experience working in a large tech company

BENEFITS

  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Enjoys building relationships
  • A preference for being organised and dependable.
  • Keen to learn and share knowledge.
  • A tendency to question things, to be critical and enquiring.
  • Comfortable with change and pragmatic decision making.
  • Happy to work under time pressure occasionally.
  • Able to manage own time.
  • Know when to ask for help or input.
  • Know when to give feedback to others.
Apply for job

items.title: Remote Sales Representative
items.content:
At CBD BioCare we believe that what we do is not a job, but an opportunity to help others. We are rapidly growing and looking for the right Sales Representatives to ensure this growth happens quickly and steadily. We are seeking dynamic, hard-working Sales Representatives with a desire to work for a nimble and entrepreneurial e-commerce organization. You will be able to collaborate with colleagues and leadership from within the company to leverage relationships and drive sales.

As a Sales Representative with CBD BioCare, you will:

Be your own boss, and work from home.

Schedule your work around your life, not the other way around. We have platforms for full and part-time reps.

Provide consistent, high-quality support to customers from your home

Demonstrate strong organizational, time management, and communication skills.

Learn and apply a knowledge of product offerings from CBD BioCare.

Forbes Magazine estimates the CBD industry will grow to 2.1 billion dollars by 2020, that s up 700% from 2016. Are you ready to be one of the first to take advantage of this unique opportunity?

When you offer our CBD BioCare products, you can feel confident that you are offering the best CBD products available. We are committed not to just marketing a product to make a buck, we are committed to offering products that our customers fall in love with. We are here for the long-term and we will do whatever it takes to earn customers and keep them.

We are not just selling CBD, we are building a CBD BioCare community, changing lives one bottle at a time.

Ready to take the next step? Apply TODAY!


  • organizational skills
  • time management
  • networking
  • sales
  • customer service

Associated topics: disney, inbound, inside sales, insurance, insurance agent, life insurance, sales, telephone, telesales, vacation

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative at Time Doctor

Remote | International

Category: Sales
Job Type: Full-Time
Job Description
We are looking for a sales development representative. This is a full-time, 100% remote position. You will need to work from 9 am to 6 pm PST, but can live anywhere in the world. (These times will change during training.) Your job will be to set up appointments to sell Time Doctor with outbound leads while working closely alongside our account executives. This position comes with a very good base salary plus generous commissions.

You will be responsible for:

  • Identifying leads. We have a research team but you might need to get involved.
  • Managing a pipeline. You will need to have excellent time management. You will most likely have more leads than you can handle and so will need to be organized and purposeful. This will be the key to your success.
  • Account management. You will need to make a minimum of 50 successful outbound calls every day. You need to be happy spending all day on the phone calling prospects and setting up appointments.

The best candidate for this job will have the following skills:

  • Hustle: You need to track down busy people and get them to talk to you. This requires creative communication, research, and hustle.
  • Quick task switching: The team is in growth mode. You will be expected to quickly switch between researching new trial users and talking to them on the phone, replying to chat (in under one minute), customizing emails, configuring trial accounts, and reviewing reports with business owners.
  • Persistence: This was already mentioned above, but it bears reiteration. You might need to email or phone someone six times before you get their attention. We need someone willing to push hard to get results.
  • Curiosity: To excel in this role, you need to be able to gain a deep understanding of each of the verticals we sell to. This means knowing the events, the companies, the products, and, most importantly, the people in each of these verticals while having your finger on the pulse of any changes or developments.
  • Experience in software sales, remote work, and management is a plus.

You must also agree to use our time tracking software while at work.

THE APPLICATION PROCESS
If you are someone who is experienced, reliable, who values punctuality, has a good work ethic, and is looking for a long-term position, please click on the APPLY button below.

This job is for a Software Sales Representative / Inside Sales Rep / Business Development Representative. This job is a 100% remote / telecommute / work from home / virtual position.

ABOUT THE COMPANY AND OUR PRODUCT
Our vision is to be the most trusted time tracking and productivity application for remote teams. We want to help companies know if their remote teams are working productively.

We develop and market Time Doctor, a time-tracking and productivity tool. Our software is used by individuals and teams to track time spent on tasks and to monitor computer activity. Time Doctor can take screenshots while a person is working, monitor keyboard and mouse activity, and track website and application usage.

We have a team of over 70 people working 100% remotely in 28 different countries.

Learn more about us here:
https://www.timedoctor.com/abo…
https://www.linkedin.com/compa…

Apply for job

items.content:
ERNEST LEOTY – Couture for Leisure


ERNEST LEOTY is a new athleisure brand, designed with a Parisian sensibility and a focus on couture details. The brand combines luxury fashion, traditional French tailoring and technical active wear seaming. We launched the brand in February 2018 and are currently stocked at Matches Fashion, Net a Porter, Le Bon Marche, Carbon38 and others. Our model is to grow direct to consumer like brands like Everlane, Glossier and SEZANE. Our main markets are France, the UK and the US.


Our main media and marketing channels are through events, influencer partnerships, and digital marketing. We want to grow fast, whilst remaining authentic to our brand values: wellness, balance, and style.


 


@ERNESTLEOTY


 


Ernest Leoty is looking for a Sales and Operations Assistant to join our team in London from September to help us sell our stock in gyms in London and other stockists around the world and help us run day-to-day operations effectively. This is an excellent opportunity to gain experience in operations and join a fast-growing start-up in the online fashion space.


 



  • Full-time internship (3-6 Months)

  • Internship based in London (Sloane square)

  • Competitive Salary


 


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Support the Head of Operations with day-to-day activity

  • Approach gyms and hotels in London and around the world to place our stock in strategic places

  • Manage relationship and logistics with small stockists, including from time to time physical presence to sell our stock

  • Manage pop-ups logistics, including being present to sell the stock

  • Manage wholesale accounts and logistics with wholesale

  • Manage stock and logistics with the warehouse

  • Excel analysis of margin, sales reports, optimization and other data analysis

  • General project management

  • General ad-hoc tasks


 


In addition to reporting to the Head of Operations – your responsibilities will vary as we are a start-up – and you may be involved in other aspects of the business.


 


REQUIREMENTS



  • Fluent – English

  • French is an advantage

  • Dynamic and pro-active

  • Ideally, previous experience in sales, logistics (at a start-up or large corporate), fashion operations (in larger corporate or in an online start-up), management

  • Quantitative skills (ideally scientific or business degree)

  • Practical sense

  • Commercially aware and good business acumen

  • Highly organized, great time management skills (able to effectively prioritize workload)

  • Attention to quality, accuracy and detail (very important)

  • Ability to multitask, think and act quickly in a fast paced environment

  • Strong desire to learn – along with a professional drive

  • Confident at bringing ideas and great problem solver

  • Strong proficiency in Excel

  • Ability to work independently & remotely


 


Become a core member of a small, but growing team.


 


NEXT STEPS


 


Please send your cv to recruiting@ernestleoty.com quoting the subject – SALES AND OPERATIONS INTERNSHIP APPLICATION – YOUR NAME


 



  • Please state start / end date

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Tax Advisor: CPA – EA at 1-800Accountant

Remote | Freelance | Part-time
  • Full Time
  • Experienced

Overview:

Led by our CEO who was voted one of the country’s 50 best CEO’s in the United States by Glassdoor, 1800Accountant is the country’s largest virtual accounting firm serving over 40,000 clients.

1-800Accountant is changing the way business owners think about accessing accounting services. Our team-based model allows our members to utilize unlimited advisory services with well seasoned Enrolled Agents and CPA’s across the country. From entity selection to individual and business returns our clients are guided by top professionals and receive hands-on service.

Located in Midtown Manhattan, our staff is a diverse team of seasoned and growing career accountants.

Who you are:

  • You are a Tax Accountant who LOVE’s TAX! You would do it just for the fun of it given the opportunity.
  • You are up to date on the latest tax code and are thrilled to see what will happen next.
  • In keeping with the mission of the company; you are eager to develop a trusted partner relationship and to focus on personalized service so that you can; understand your client’s business, analyze each scenario, and make personalized accounting advice.
  • Whether its tax preparation or tax advisory, you are compelled to be the best at what you do. You seek answers to questions and are always continuing your education. You take responsibility for your actions and commitments.
  • You are a top-notch communicator. You adhere to a consultative approach, always listening first with empathy so that you can earn your clients trust. You are comfortable building relationships and presenting information by phone and in writing.
  • Problem-solving, analytic thinking and collaboration come naturally to you. You work to effectively transfer knowledge to others, both one on one and in a group. You are willing to both share your ideas and take direction.
  • As a Tax Advisor, you are thrilled when your clients are successful!

Skills and Experience:

  • Ability and interest in participating in a Remote/Virtual Accounting environment.
  • BS Accounting or other relevant degree or combination of education and experience
  • Enrolled Agent Licence and/or CPA Certification
  • Prepare individual (1040) and business tax returns (1120,1120’s,1065) and associated schedules and financial statements
  • Participation in preparing personal and business tax returns for a minimum of 2 tax seasons
  • Proficiency in related technologies; spreadsheets, tax prep and bookkeeping software (Lacerte is a plus)
  • Analytical: Collect and research data, synthesize complex and diverse information
  • Organization: Design workflows and procedures to ensure deadlines are achieved
  • Working knowledge of general business practices and ability to demonstrate business and financial acumen
  • Ability to coach, train and assist in mentoring less experienced staff
  • Experience advising business entities, tax preparation, payroll and bookkeeping
  • Ability to manage a high volume of clients across verticals with poise
Apply for job

items.title: Hotjar: Inbound Sales Specialist (Americas)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Inbound Sales Specialist (Americas)

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only considering candidates based within the EST timezone. 

We’re looking for someone with inbound sales experience, ideally from a SaaS background, to join our growing sales team. We approach sales from an educational mindset, and pride ourselves on being product-experts so we can help customers solve their problems.

Reporting to our Sales Lead, you'll help us develop new sales programs that are personable and educational, but also scalable. You should understand the evolution of SaaS sales (freemium model), and can apply that to building a sales pipeline that creates successful onboarding during trials, and closes the ideal leads.

As the team grows, you’ll also help determine strategy and processes for increasing expansions and renewals. You’ll collaborate with our Revenue-focused teams to evolve and improve our pricing strategy to ensure that we’re correctly aligning customers to the right payment plan. You will also be an advocate for our leads and customers on improving our early onboarding experience which helps leads convert.

Our ideal team member for this role is numbers-oriented and experienced working with a high volume of leads. You are as comfortable thinking through how to approach transactional sales with high-touch, personable interactions that educate our leads, as you are in conceiving self-service experiences for SMBs. You’ll be naturally curious and empathetic in understanding the needs of our customers. 

You will:
  • Perform product demos and present webinars for both prospects and customers.
  • Refine and develop how we converse with prospective clients to ensure they are educated on what they can achieve with our product.
  • Determine and lead projects that make it possible for leads to self-serve their sales-related needs.
  • Identify ways to improve our onboarding experience.
  • Develop and maintain a sales opportunity and forecast system.
  • Assist and determine our capabilities on Pilots, POCs and RFPs.
  • Collaborate with the Customer Success team both during the sales pipeline and at the handover stage.
  • Collaborate with leadership to help determine pricing and product line strategy, and to identify new markets we can enter and develop plans to do so effectively.
  • Work with Finance, Legal and DevOps to ensure the team is efficiently issuing and managing estimates, invoices, legal agreements and security documents.
  • Partner with Marketing to create and promote market specific programs and lead generation campaigns.
  • Communicate prospective customer needs to product managers and product teams.
  • Help establish training material and programmes as the Sales team grows. 

Requirements
  • 3+ years of inbound sales experience, with high-volume, SMB accounts, ideally SaaS. Customer Success experience would be considered advantageous.
  • Customer-facing experience in a technology environment - empathetic to the challenges customers face.
  • Tech-minded - able to develop a keen understanding and technical knowledge to speak clearly to customers and communicate their needs to our team.
  • Be comfortable taking calls and closing deals while also thinking strategically about growing our sales efforts.
  • Experience adapting sales skills for a diverse customer base, with an educational mindset.
  • Experience of approaching process in a scalable way and implementing pipelines that are efficient in closing leads at high-volume.
  • Naturally empathetic - must be comfortable talking to different types of potential customers from multiple industries and technical abilities.
  • Experience with managing renewals.
  • A desire to work in a respectful, caring, and transparent work environment, following Hotjar’s company values, culture and ways of working
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third-party. 

What we offer
  • A remote and accomplished diverse and international team.
  • A chance to positively enhance people’s experience online and make the web a better place.
  • Annual learning and development budget.
  • Several perks designed for your well-being and a healthy work-life balance (Holiday Budget, Wellbeing Allowance, Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid parental leave, and much more).

Compensation Range
The budgeted compensation range for this role is $56,500 to $73,000 annually (we do not have a commission or bonus scheme at Hotjar). Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

items.title: Senior Sales Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Role


Close monthly SaaS revenue deals by understanding the needs and buying process of prospective corporate partners and demonstrating the value and ROI of the WeGift platform.


Responsibilities



  • Working closely with marketing and an incoming SDR to assist in researching, qualifying and accepting sales leads.

  • Initiate proactive discovery processes with prospective leads to qualify timing, organisational technical and commercial fit.

  • Proactively analyse and evaluate discovery and sales calls to continually improve the sales process, feeding back to the wider team.

  • Educate prospective partners on the benefits of digital gift cards, technology as a service and monthly pricing as a commercial model.

  • Build ROI calculators and commercials models to assist the partner in their commercial decision.

  • Gather key commercial, technical and contractual requirements as part of the closing and onboarding process.

  • Working closely with Implementation and Customer Success Managers to assist with successful customer launches

  • Evaluating your own process and the wider teams and continually feeding back to iterate and refine the sales process.

  • Ensure CRM, sales notes, and reporting data is clean, precise and up to date.


Requirements



  • 4-6 years enterprise SaaS or PaaS B2B sales experience.

  • Proven track record of selling to mid-market and enterprise customers with minimum contract values of £20k per annum.

  • Proven record of delivering month-on-month sales growth, with a decreasing sales cycle and an increasing close rate.


What’s in for you?


We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us. We have taken the time to tailor a number of them to fit our culture and ethos.


Compensation



  • £40-60k annual performance bonus (paid quarterly based on objectives)


Benefits



  • Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.

  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new We Work office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


 


Successful candidates will be contacted within two weeks.

items.title: Toggl: Inbound Sales Account Executive
items.content:
Inbound Sales Account Executive

Toggl is an easy to use and flexible time tracking tool that helps 3+ million users see where their work time goes, so they can focus on the projects that really matter. It also works on all your devices, and integrates with over a 100 tools. 

We are looking for a savvy Account Executive to help kick-start our Inbound Sales team.

The role
As an Account Executive, you will help us build an Inbound Sales team that would educate our customers about the value of Toggl in a thoughtful way. You will learn about the clients’ business needs and service usage patterns and then provide recommendations for our product development. You will drive the sales process with prospective customers as well as expansion within existing accounts. In this role, you will assist defining, building and monitoring repeatable and scalable processes for upselling Toggl to 20+ user teams on the Premium plan. Our Marketing and Product teams will give you strong support for proactively improving product experience and conversion rates. In order to track success, you will set up analytics and KPIs relevant for the new team. 

About you
You will succeed in this role if you have a results-driven mindset and a strong drive to achieve goals. You have at least 3 years of experience with closing deals on the scale of at least 10k$, preferably in a SaaS business. You also have experience in leading a team of at least 5 people. You have strong executive abilities and are not scared of experimentation and changing direction. Starting new tactical initiatives excites you and you are able to explain your plans in business terms as well as create workflow specs for the team. You have excellent written and spoken English. Experience working remotely and understanding the remote culture is a plus.

About our team
Toggl is a distributed team of 80+ people working remotely from 30 countries. We take pride in our professional, learning-oriented and friendly working environment that values work-life balance and constantly doing our best in every aspect of our work. You can work from anywhere in the world, because we know great people do awesome work wherever they are. Every few months we travel to meet up somewhere in the world and spend some quality time together. Our business is profitable with a healthy margin and we’re built with no outside investments, so you can count on a stable working environment.

Some benefits
  • Freedom to choose when and where you work from.
  • 28 calendar days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays.
  • 2 company retreats plus 2 team meetups a year (expenses covered) for team-building.
  • Laptop and a €2,000 budget to set up your home office.
  • Reimbursement for co-working space rent or internet service at home.
  • Opportunities to attend trainings, workshops or conferences.
  • Monthly reimbursement for gym membership, massage and other things to improve your health.
  • Support for buying a phone, eyeglasses or tools you need for doing your best work.

The salary for this position is 60,000 USD annually.

Apply now!
All it takes to apply is answering a short skills test that assesses your expertise. Please note that only candidates who take the test will be considered.

Free Toggl t-shirt for those who do well on the test!

items.title: Sales Associate
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


£25-35k pa base salary, £40-65k 1st Year OTE


Hubble is one of the UK’s leading PropTech startups and is changing the face of commercial property. Our mission is to find the perfect home for every company and we’ve built an online platform to help businesses rent, manage and share office space. We are now on the lookout for our next sales superstar to join our rapidly growing sales team.


We are looking for an experienced sales professional who can support our clients with their office search by making recommendations, answering questions, arranging viewings, negotiating with office providers, and ultimately making sure they find and book the best space for them. This is an excellent opportunity to work in an established but fast growing team of successful sales professionals.




 


REQUIREMENTS



  • At least one year of commercial sales or account management experience

  • Strong track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets

  • Ideally experience of working for a technology company or startup

  • Know your way around London

  • Well developed negotiation, presentation, and communication skills with strong consultative sales approach

  • Ability to organise and prioritise your workload independently

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and fluctuating environment and willingness to learn new tools




 


BENEFITS


We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits are optional and can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:



  • Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.

  • Bonus based on sales generated.

  • Equity options.

  • Macbook, and peripherals.

  • Expense budget & travel.

  • Noise-cancelling headphones.

  • Spotify Premium or Apple Music.

  • Kindle Unlimited + free technical books.

  • Health & Pension.

  • Cycle to Work scheme.


2018 Winner of Property Week’s ‘Best Company to Work For’ – Role Satisfaction, Culture and Communication, Relationship with Supervisor, Training and Development


Additionally, being part of Entrepreneur First, 500 startups and Seedcamp gives us (and you) access to a vibrant startup community, office hours and talks with industry experts.


We truly value our people and company culture. Want to know more about why Hubble is a great place to work? Check out this recent blog post.

items.title: Prospect: Sales Executive
items.content:
Sales Executive


ABOUT THE ROLE

This unique role is a blend of the traditional Sales Development (“SDR”) and Account Executive (“AE”) roles. 

In the first 3 months, you will:

  • Source new leads (using Prospect )

  • Send cold emails and make calls

  • Schedule meetings for a seasoned sales rep on the team

Once you’re fully ramped up, in the next 3 months you are expected to:

  • Consistently meet quota of booking 25 meetings per month

  • Start doing your own sales calls and demos

Once you’ve grown into the role, your final responsibilities will be:

  • Finding your own prospects

  • Booking meetings with them

  • Negotiating and closing deals

If you’re looking for challenges to grow or have entrepreneurial dreams, this is an excellent role for you to get exposure to working with VPs, Directors, and C-level decision makers.

We’ve set this “full stack sales” role up this way so that you’re always growing and exposed to new challenges instead of being forced into one very specific responsibility. 

ABOUT YOU

You are always learning. You believe that the only way to grow is to be independent and always be learning. Prior experience at a startup or SaaS company is highly preferred.

You genuinely enjoy helping and talking to people. You realize that sales is about building authentic long-term relationships. You must have prior sales or SDR experience that shows this.

Your are creative and tech savvy. You realize that your prospects get flooded with cold emails and you look for ways to stand out from the crowd. Experience with outbound software (Outreach.io, Salesloft) and other sales tech (GoVideo, Cirrus Insight) is a big plus!

You focus on quality over quantity. You believe that it is better to write ten high quality cold emails versus one hundred cookie-cutter emails.

You don’t make excuses. You realize that there will always be objections and you get a thrill from dealing with them.

ABOUT US

We started in 2014 with three founders. We are currently a hybrid-remote team of 12 people that is spread over 6 different cities worldwide.

We’re fully independent and bootstrapped with $0 raised from VCs or investors. We did this so we can focus on the two things that matter the most: our customers and our team.

Every customer we have today was sourced using our own product (Prospect) or via word-of-mouth. Our sales team is very small (< 3 people) and you will work very closely with our CEO on a regular basis.

COMPENSATION, BENEFITS, AND PERKS

The salary for this role is $80,000 Canadian dollars (OTE; $40,000 base, $40,000 commission). This will be adjusted as you start doing your own meetings and start closing deals.

You can choose to work from our Kitchener-Waterloo office, entirely remote (any country), or a blend of both. You are encouraged to work where you perform best.

We believe that you should have good equipment to do your work and we give a laptop of your choice once you’re up and running.

We give ample time off. Everyone gets 4 weeks paid-time-off. Additionally, we work four-day workweeks every July and August. We also offer a generous vacation allowance.

If you are authorized to work in Canada, we will also give you health benefits under our company HSA. If you decide to work from the office, you will also get daily catered lunches.

WHAT’S NEXT

If this sounds like something you would like to be a part of, we would love to hear from you!

We usually get hundreds of job applicants and we read through every single one of them. We highly recommend applying with a good cover letter if you would like to stand out.

Within two weeks of applying, you will hear from us if you’ve made it to the next stage which will be a quick culture screening. You will then have an hour long call with the team. After that, you will proceed to the final stage of interviews which will be specific to the role and then to the final offer.
